Box 94064 Baton Rouge, LA 70804-9064 (225) 342-1805 (225) 342-1912 Fax E-mail:  Brenda.Rivet@la.gov Department's Toll-Free Number 1-877-453-2721 </supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>October 17, 2006</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>publication date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>Annually</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-93.832600</westbc> <eastbc>-89.847500</eastbc> <northbc>32.803400</northbc> <southbc>29.596700</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>Academy</themekt> <themekey>College</themekey> <themekey>Cultural</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>Alma Mater</themekt> </theme> <theme> <themekt>Association</themekt> </theme> <theme> <themekt>Brainery</themekt> </theme> <theme> <themekt>Hall</themekt> </theme> <theme> <themekt>Institute</themekt> </theme> <theme> <themekt>Lyceum</themekt> </theme> <theme> <themekt>Organization</themekt> </theme> <theme> <themekt>Seminary</themekt> </theme> <theme> <themekt>University</themekt> </theme> <place> <placekey>Louisiana</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None.</accconst> <useconst>None.</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>Section of Environmental Epidemiology and Toxicology (SEET)</cntorg> <cntper>William "Clay" Trachtman</cntper> </cntorgp> <cntpos>GIS Coordinator</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>628 North 4th Street</address> <address>P.O. Box 4489</address> <city>Baton Rouge</city> <state>Louisiana</state> <postal>70821</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(225) 219-4183</cntvoice> <cntfax>(225) 342-8117</cntfax> <cntemail>ctrachtm@dhh.la.gov</cntemail> <hours>8:30 AM - 5:00 PM</hours> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <browse> <browsen><URL: colleges_06_07_full_ldoe_LDHH_2006.gif></browsen> <browset>GIF</browset> </browse> <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.0.1324</native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar> This dataset was geocoded by the Louisiana Department of Health and Hospitals, Office of Public Health, Section of Environmental Epidemiology and Toxicology (SEET) using the most current edition of Map Marker Plus at the date of publication.  In the GeoResult column, there is a 10 digit value.  Only the first 2 digits are of importance (i.e. S1, S5, M1, Z1).  The SEET Geocoding process is as follows:  1st Run Manually geocoded results (S5----SEET) from the previous year's database are imported into the new database.  2nd Run Automatically geocoded, not allowing any kind of fall back (only exact matches are accepted).  3rd Run Unmatched records are interactively geocoded, checking for minor errors such as spelling.  Other adjustments to the address may be made at this time.  The following are examples of these adjustments:  Street Name:  Street name may be adjusted.  Example 1: Highway 35 may also be known as Main Street; however, the Geocoding program may not recognize the address 123 Highway 35.  In this case, the geocoder would interactively enter the address 123 Main Street in order to get an acceptable georesult.  A note of this correction would be made in the GR_NOTES column.  The note would read "Main Street".  Example 2: The geocoding program can not find an address of 123 Lewis St., the program suggests the address may be 123 Lewis Blvd.  Once this address is verified as being correct, it will be geocoded.  A note of this correction would be made in the GR_NOTES column.  The note would read "Lewis Blvd" or just "Blvd".  Address Number: The address number may be adjusted slightly.  Example: The geocoding program can not find the address 123 Main Street; however, the program can find the address 125 Main Street (with a very high accuracy).  In this case the geocoder would accept the address of 125 Main Street.   A note of this correction would be made in the GR_NOTES column.  The note would read "125 Main Street" or just "125".  Additionally, less exact georesults are now accepted.  Georesults starting with either "S4" or "S3" are now accepted (definitions are below).  From our experience, these results are extremely close to being accurate, usually within a tenth of a mile in urban areas (larger error in rural areas).  4th Run Any record that can not be geocoded during the first two runs will be interactively geocoded.  This process may involve calling up the facility and locating them on the most recent georectified aerial images that we have.  The corresponding latitude and longitude will then be entered.  These records will have the georesult of "S5----SEET".  NOTE: Some of the records may have the GeoResult "S5----SEET" and a GeoResult Note.  This means that in the process of interactively geocoding the record, it was discovered that street may have more then one name (i.e. 123 Main Street is the same as 123 Highway 25).  In this event, the new version of the address will be run through the most current version of Map Marker Plus.  The corresponding latitude and longitude will then be transferred to the database.  A note of this incident would be made in the GR_NOTES column.  The note would read "123 Highway 25".  In a dataset geocoded by SEET, there should only be georesults starting with "S5", "S4", or "S3".  SEET does not accept multiple matches or "Zip Code Fall Back" matches. </horizpar> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>S1xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Single close match, point located at ZIP Code centroid.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>S2xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Single close match, point located at ZIP+2 centroid.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>S3xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Single close match, point located at ZIP+4 centroid.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>S4xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Single close match, point located at the center of a shape point path (shape points define the shape of the street polyline).</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>S5xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Single close match, point located at a street address position (highest accuracy available).</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>S6xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Single close match, point located at point ZIP centroid (usually a PO Box).</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>SXxxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Single close match, point located at street intersection.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>S0xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Single close match, no coordinates available (very rare occurrence).</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>M1xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Multiple close matches, point located at ZIP Code centroid.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>M2xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Multiple close matches, point located at ZIP+2 centroid.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>M3xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Multiple close matches, point located at ZIP+4 centroid.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>M4xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Multiple close matches, point located at the center of a shape point path (shape points define the shape of the street polyline).</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>M5xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Multiple close matches, point located at a street address position (highest accuracy available).</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>M6xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Multiple close matches, point located at point zip location.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>MXxxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Multiple close matches, point located at street intersection.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>M0xxxxxxxx</horizpav> <horizpae>Multiple close matches, no coordinates available.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>Z1</horizpav> <horizpae>ZIP Code centroid match.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>Z2</horizpav> <horizpae>ZIP+2 centroid match.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>Z3</horizpav> <horizpae>ZIP+4 centroid match (highest accuracy available).</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>Z0</horizpav> <horizpae>ZIP Code match, no coordinates available (very rare).</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>Z6</horizpav> <horizpae>ZIP Code centroid match for point ZIP.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>N</horizpav> <horizpae>No close match. These records can be re-geocoded interactively or during subsequent automatic passes under different matching conditions.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>NX</horizpav> <horizpae>No close match for street intersections.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>ND</horizpav> <horizpae>MapMarker could not find the Address Dictionary for the given ZIP Code or city/state. These records can be re-geocoded once the Address Dictionary is available. An ND code can also appear in the fields of ZIP+4 output columns, e.g., MapMarker returns 12180-23ND. In this case the ND code represents ZIP+4 Codes associated with nondelivery areas such as vacant lots or other areas to which the US Postal Service does not deliver mail.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>NG</horizpav> <horizpae>The user marks these records during interactive geocoding as non-geocodable. MapMarker does not attempt to match these records again until the code is removed.</horizpae> </qhorizpa> </horizpa> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srctime></srctime> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>Exported to ESRI shapefile using MapInfo's Universal Translater.</procdesc> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc>Dataset moved.</procdesc> <srcused>LDOE_Colleges_06_07_Full_LDHH</srcused> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc>Dataset moved.</procdesc> <srcused>LDOE_Colleges_06_07_Full_LDHH</srcused> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc>Dataset moved.</procdesc> <srcused>LDOE_colleges_06_07_full_LDHH_2006</srcused> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc>Dataset moved.</procdesc> <srcused>colleges_06_07_full_ldoe_LDHH_2006</srcused> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <direct>Vector</direct> <ptvctinf> <sdtsterm> <sdtstype>Entity point</sdtstype> <ptvctcnt>77</ptvctcnt> </sdtsterm> </ptvctinf> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <geograph> <latres>0.000000</latres> <longres>0.000000</longres> <geogunit>Decimal degrees</geogunit> </geograph> <geodetic> <horizdn>North American Datum of 1983</horizdn> <ellips>Geodetic Reference System 80</ellips> <semiaxis>6378137.000000</semiaxis> <denflat>298.257222</denflat> </geodetic> </horizsys> </spref> <eainfo> <detailed> <enttyp> <enttypl>colleges_06_07_full_ldoe_LDHH_2006</enttypl> </enttyp> <attr> <attrlabl>GR_NOTES</attrlabl> <attrdef>Any notes regarding the geocode accuracy. These data have been developed from the best available sources.  Although efforts have been made to ensure that the data are accurate and reliable, errors and variable conditions originating from physical sources used to develop the data may be reflected in the data supplied. Users must be aware of these conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, scale, resolution, rectification, positional accuracy, development methodology, time period, environmental and climatic conditions and other circumstances specific to these data.  The user is responsible for understanding the accuracy limitations of the data provided herein.  The burden for determining fitness for use lies entirely with the user.  The user should refer to the accompanying metadata notes for a description of the data and data development procedures.  Although these data have been processed successfully on computers at the LOSCO, no guarantee, expressed or implied, is made by LOSCO regarding the use of these data on any other system, nor does the act of distribution constitute or imply any such warranty.
